metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3380 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The (1) init.d/slurm and (2) init.d/slurmdbd scripts in SLURM before 2.1.14place the . (dot) directory in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which allows localusers to gain privileges via a Trojan horse shared library in the currentworking directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3380` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-slurm - 2.6.5-1
libpmi0 - 2.6.5-1
libslurm-perl - 2.6.5-1
libslurm26 - 2.6.5-1
libslurmdb-perl - 2.6.5-1
libslurmdb26 - 2.6.5-1
slurm-llnl - 2.6.5-1
slurm-llnl-basic-plugins - 2.6.5-1
slurm-llnl-slurmdbd - 2.6.5-1
slurm-llnl-sview - 2.6.5-1
slurm-llnl-torque - 2.6.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.5-1').
